data.title: Starting C&C Causes Crash
data.body:
Playing red alert doesn't cause this. But upon starting a game of c&c (original) my machine crashes.
It doesn't write to any logs, and I cannot escape it.
It works fine on RA but not c&c.
In my particular case I know this happens when I play a skirmish against bots, but unsure about online.

I'm running windows 10 and if you need any additional info, just let me know.

data.title: Fake buildings should count for "build off of".
data.body: Its such a pain in the ass to make fake buildings and then you cant build on the other side of it so you have to build around it. Whats so bid if you could just build off them? If you were gonna basewalk with them power plants would be a better choice right?

data.title: RA - Added Fake Power Plants for France
data.body: As discussed in #10437.

data.title: ORA Mechanic: Infantry standing from prone.
data.body:
In C&C95 and RA96 you can cancel infantry out from their prone status by double clicking the mouse button. This would cancel them out from prone and actually ignore the prone status until they stood still and go back to prone again.

This allowed infantry to run from targets or even perhaps rush at targets (IE: GTs in C&C95) to do their damage or run for cover.

The interesting thing about this is going out from prone increases damage takened while remaining in prone reduced damage. So you came with some decisions as "Remain in prone or run at the risk of a quick death?" which became rather situational.

data.title: Assigning a non-existant owner in Lua leads to cryptic stacktrace
data.body:
I have not been able to find a fix for this that actually works.

See [this gist](https://gist.github.com/Phrohdoh/efac7aa61e0be1d6fbd3) for the full story.

Resolution:

```
18:03 <+pchote> can you identify what line is null?
18:03 <+Phrohdoh> foreach (var visibilityModifier in visibilityModifiers)
18:04 <+pchote> that line isn't referenced from bodyorientation
18:04 <+pchote> I bet its something really dumb
18:04 <+pchote> like you assigning a null owner
```

This is exactly what I was doing.

``` lua
        local amphib = Actor.Create('sapc', false, {
            Owner = Soviets,
            Location = spawnCell,
            Cargo = unitComposition
        })
```

Correct code:

``` lua
        local amphib = Actor.Create('sapc', false, {
            Owner = soviets,
            Location = spawnCell,
            Cargo = unitComposition
        })
```

I was using `Soviets` where the owner should have been `soviets`.

data.title: Strengthen trait ordering rules
data.body:
Fixes #10907.

Currently, if you have multiple dependencies for a trait, as long as one of them is created first then the ordering is satisfied. This means the others might be created after the thing that requires them!

Now, we strengthen the rules to require all of the dependencies to be created up front. This means the dependent can now guarantee all its dependencies are ready, rather than just at least one.

I have adjusted the tests to verify this.

This created some circular dependency chains on `UpgradeManager` in the default mods which I have resolved by doing the trait lookups after the actor is created. Without this RA and D2k fail to load.

data.title: Fix TakeCover dependence on AttackTurreted.
data.body: Fixes #10962.

data.title: Rework map data load/save.
data.body: This reorganizes the map fields into a semblance of order, and, where possible, makes them readonly or `{ private set; }`.  Also tidies up the TS map importer a bit.

data.title: Infantry cannot attack anything
data.body:
They don't attack not they can't be attacked
Happens in current bleed build but not in release version.
Here's replay https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/26177594/ShareX/2016/03/OpenRA-2016-03-21T211226Z.orarep

data.title: Added animation support to infantry stand sequences
data.body: This is required for swim animations. https://github.com/OpenRA/ra2/pull/172 comes with a test case.

data.title: Add an explicit YamlException to ParatroopersPower.SendParatroopers
data.body: Instead of a `KeyNotFoundException`.

data.title: Expose passenger enter/exit notifications to Lua
data.body:
Example usage:

``` lua
    local trans = Actor.Create(...)

    Trigger.OnPassengerExited(trans, function(_, passenger)
        passenger.AttackMove(somewhere.Location)

        if not trans.HasPassengers then
            trans.Move(somewhere_else.Location)
        end
    end)

...

Trigger.OnPassengerExited(myTransport, DoStuff)

DoStuff = function(trans, pass)
    if pass.Type == "dog" then
        trans.Destroy()
    end
end
```

data.title: Bring back artillery chain-explosion
data.body: It was the only real way to deal with arty spam and now its gone(or broken).

data.title: Fix D2k deviator not taking effect
data.body:
The warhead's scan range was lower than both the missile inaccuracy as well as the Missile CloseEnough value of 298, so it almost never "hit" the target.

Closes #10278.

data.title: Add NamedActorNames to MapGlobal
data.body:
This allows a script author to do something like:

``` lua
    for name, actor in pairs(Map.NameToActorKeyValues) do
        -- do something with `name` and `actor`
    end
```

Real-world example:
I am assigning owners based on the actor's name in yaml (which corresponds to player spawn points).

``` lua
spawn2alpha = { }
spawn2alpha[1] = 'a'
spawn2alpha[2] = 'b'
spawn2alpha[3] = 'c'
spawn2alpha[4] = 'd'

SetupStartingForces = function(player)
    for name, actor in pairs(Map.NameToActorKeyValues) do
        local prefix = name:sub(0, 1):lower()
        if prefix == spawn2alpha[player.Spawn] then
            actor.Owner = player
        end
    end
end
```

Where the `Actors` section of the `map.yaml` contains entries like this:

``` yaml
    a_caoild_1: caoild
        Location: 49,12
        Owner: Neutral
    a_caoild_2: caoild
        Location: 50,15
        Owner: Neutral
    b_caoild_1: caoild
        Location: 85,-45
        Owner: Neutral
    b_caoild_2: caoild
        Location: 83,-42
        Owner: Neutral
    c_caoild_1: caoild
        Owner: Neutral
        Location: 142,-1
    c_caoild_2: caoild
        Owner: Neutral
        Location: 144,2
    d_gapile_1: gapile
        Owner: Neutral
        Location: 102,43
    d_e1_1: e1
        Owner: Neutral
        Location: 81,44
    d_e1_2: e1
        Owner: Neutral
        Location: 100,53
```

data.title: Fix filename case of sandworm attack sound
data.body: Fixes #10936.

data.title: [RA] Official Map Pool: Alter Keep Off The Grass 2 (2 players) - balance, aesthetics
data.body:
[**Keep Off The Grass 2, current**](http://resource.openra.net/maps/7242/), (2 players)

Changes:
Moved the first ore patch for both spawns to balance ore access.
Changed ridges and debris to balance fields around the players.  #10347
Tweaked the players spawn's first ore field after discussion below.

[**Keep Off The Grass 2, altered**](http://resource.openra.net/maps/9542/), Playtested (revision 4), altered to revision 5 after discussion below.

![keep off the grass 2 compare revision](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2715583/14116632/fe7edd3c-f5e0-11e5-829e-0733d9072fbd.png)

![keep off the grass 2 rew](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2715583/14116636/05f65b58-f5e1-11e5-8683-7f8252d4523f.png)

data.title: [RA] Official Map Pool: Alter Man to Man (2 players) - balance, aesthetics
data.body:
[**Man to Man, current**](http://resource.openra.net/maps/7196/), (2 players)

Changes:
Accessed the oil derricks by bridge to avoid Allied dominance (Transport Helicopter).
Tweaked ore fields to stall immediate run towards middle.
Added detail scenery.

[**Man to Man, altered**](http://resource.openra.net/maps/9230/), playtested. No issues encountered.

![man to man compare](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2715583/13900701/eb8100b0-ee0c-11e5-8fd6-92d69e6cfaca.png)

![man to man compare](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2715583/13900896/4f8a2452-ee11-11e5-8a43-0aa304620eb6.png)

[**Snowy Ridge, current**](http://resource.openra.net/maps/7996/), (6 players)

data.title: Add --map-rules utility command for the resource center
data.body: This adds a command that merges the custom rules into a single block that can be included as part of the map API.  Can be tested together with #10947.

data.title: Remove cnc mission boilerplate
data.body:
This makes use of the new feature allowing maps to include mod files to remove most of the boilerplate definitions from the cnc campaign.

Also fixes the starting music on gdi05b (was defined on Player instead of World), and fixes the spelling of the civilian player on gdi04c.

data.title: Add a "Lonestar AI" to Fort Lonestar
data.body: Makes use of the feature introduced in #10916.

data.title: Crash on Linux
data.body:
The game crashed while playing skirmish.

This is the log entry:

> Red Alert Mod at Version release-20151224
> on map 1ab7971f4efcd61f4a3007704c1f08f72d8686a2 (Mad Science by PizzaAtomica).
> Operating System: Linux (Unix 3.16.0.38)
> Runtime Version: Mono 3.2.8 (Debian 3.2.8+dfsg-4ubuntu1.1) CLR 4.0.30319.17020
> Exception of type `System.InvalidOperationException`: Attempted to finalize an undisposed DisposableAction. hind (446) reserved fix (398)
>   at OpenRA.Mods.Common.Traits.Reservable+<Reserve>c__AnonStorey0.<>m__2 () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
>   at OpenRA.Primitives.ActionQueue.PerformActions (Int32 currentTime) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
>   at OpenRA.Game.LogicTick () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
>   at OpenRA.Game.Loop () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
>   at OpenRA.Game.Run () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
>   at OpenRA.Program.Run (System.String[] args) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
>   at OpenRA.Program.Main (System.String[] args) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0

data.title: MapSize/Bounds calculation when creating new map is broken
data.body: If I tell the editor to create a 64x80 map, it creates a 64x96 map. 64x78 resulted in 64x94. So it always adds 16 to the height. Pretty annoying.

data.title: Move Map.TilesByDistance to MapGrid and un-static it.
data.body: As a bonus, mods can now configure the 50 cell limit in their mod.yaml.

data.title: Remove map lazyness.
data.body: `Map` objects are now only initialized when we need access to the full map object.  This removes a layer of indirection that is no longer necessary, cleaning up the public interface and making the performance and memory usage more predictable.

data.title: Add numbering to the grid in Map Editor
data.body:
There used to be a feature that numbers showed when you turn on the grid. This is especially handy when you try to create a symetrical map and lots of time is spent on counting squares to make sure it is exactly mirrored.

So, feature request: bring back the square numbering when grid is turned on!
- edited the title for a better description. I meant a ruler on top and bottom and both sides numbering every 10 squares or so. Also every 10th line could be a bit thicker so hat even on a big map you can see easily which square you want to edit.
